TextBlock.TextLine: lyes ready here can be sent att any time besides shall not proceed in buying
before I finde yd order, that itt is to yd content what already sent, for if
that doth not prove exceeding well I must give up thought i do not fancy the
narrow laces, as I could have wished, yett hope to have yd approbation that
they may render you a considerable intrest, for they deserve itt when
you receam these goods send mee also yd advised & opinion as to the
ordering of them & if you please to have the rest don up in the same
manner, not questioning butt that the packetts are now finall enough
yd in ordered lumen is ready to be sent to bruges to m. Rapael coots
to come pr. first vessel for London, which is the needfull att pol sent
inclosed is the second bill of the £150 remitted provided the first
was not come to handes so take care the needfull
In Antwarp 21 Janu
London Henry Collier
th
th
S my last to you was on the 4 curitt, sence recd. yd of 24: past with the
procuration & letter to m. Antonj Herreyns which have delivered him &
he hath been with TH. & showne him his order, wherefore did all he could
to persuade him to complyance, or elce that he would force him by law
he hath very farely comted & begged to delay butt 14 dayes which he
hath granted him in hopes to gaine his owne reason against him, butt
in case he doth not comply there he will proceed, this herreyns promised
to write you himself so give him directly yd positive order & answer
which he may show TH. that then he certainly sees itt is yd will
so & then lett him do his best butt I feare he hath itt nott whoever I should
be gladd in case, he could comply with the £280 I hope RS with you
as soone as this: my next shall bring yd acctt they beeng ready to be
drawne out: Ben klerck is not yett arrived uso wishing you all good
Brussel Joseph Sabberton
In Antwarp 21 Janu
33 th
S in answer to yd of yd 19 curitt observe the invoyce of the laces you bought
for mee, which I could wish here I beleave the messenger is the best
way were fore you could make itt up in a packett as itt should be send to
England & send itt mee p a trusty bode, please also to send by itt 20 3 elle
of seer cloth for I do want itt I hope so see you in few dayes when shall
give you satisfaction & the true opinion of yd buing if the waters
were open, should come this week, butt if not itt shall be next god
willing, which is thenedfull a present from, if you rekon my danger
by land you may sending till I come butt give advise of what you
have don to governe my self according
Rotterdam John vandermaulen
In Antwerpen 23 Janu 1681
Mons. den ul van 31 past is mij op sijn tijt geworden & nae ul reseprofey
gewenst te hebbe een geluck saligh nieuwe jaer hope dat bij nu John
brouwe voldaen hebft, hebbe door noot om gelt heden op ul gevalieet
in twee a 3 dage te betaelen Jan d ordre van s adriaen de maren vierhord
ut
oet voorde weirde al hier ontfang van geory
achteug guldens cosant
borsheek ick recommandeere ul dier mijns brief sal dan wijders
ul rek corant afwaghten & met verlange te verstaende voldoen
van John brove om mede de saecke tot ul contentement t
terwijlen Blijve
In Antwerpen 24 Janu 1681
Ausso Joan Button
Mons. volgens ul schrijven van 17 deser heb het gelt wel ontfang sijnde
£52:24:5 ende het selve die volgens te boeck gesielt in gesloten heeft ul
de quitantie voor wed de kooy, mijn laken serges sijn noch niet
gearriveert dan worden dagelijck verwah het geen roy cottons soo en senden
geen ander gelieft de serge bij ul te handen en het beste daer mede
te doen ickt had aen ul gesoende Reb gesonden, doch het schejnt dat den
bode den brief verloren heeft, al hoe wel ick hem selv bestelt
was van 10 deser ½ wit frisees N 474 a 42 a 12 ½. 13 ƒ26:5
3 sergen a ƒ25:15
1 wilt kerbije
samen ƒ125:10
alle engels goederen slaen seer op in Engelant wwel 15 ac6 pr
wel deorder als voor leden iaer ick ben godt lof noch wel versien
kan ul tegens den rasten wel accommedeeren waer iets voor
valt ete sende de 5 sacken noch mede
In Antwerp 24 Janu 1681
Lille Bed Whiting
S. after haveing wished you by this on happy prosperious new jeare desire
onely to be informed what news you have of the embarge in all frenh
harborought, as itt is ragated here butt in certainly I to be besides that
english vessels att dunquerque are taken of thier rodders intrim I supose
m. Richd. Southell is gon for england before this shall come to yd handes
excuse this my desire & in the like occasion freely command him the
London Will Scawen
In Antwarp 25 juni 1681
th r
S. sence I wrott you last on the 13xb from you thought I could have
wished to understand yd opinion of the acctt of sale sent you, & if the proffitt
is to yd content, the most part of what was resting then is sold, no less, butt
more then calculated to be worth by p same acctt some res onely
resting: sence also have sold part of the callicoes last reclaned, butt can not
exceed 10 a 12 pr et. proffitt, & have already about £60 st for you in casse, so
pleased to give mee yd order if you will have itt remitted att sight or 2 uso,
or sent in gold, or otherwise, whilst I shall endeavour to make it up
£100: by that time yd answer comes: I have recd 2 bales from bruges by
waggon N1 & 2, butt those that cost 31: bare & prove no better then
those of 29:6, so that I finde the salempores dijed do render best, my
customers demand brown salempores as the bale N2 is of which wee
may consult to wards next sale whilst I wish you an happy new
jeare & remaine
In Antwarp 25 January 1681
London Henry Maynard
th
S. my last to you was on the 18 curitt sence recd. yd of 10 ditto, this well that
my remises are accepted, I do not question their due complyance unpay.
es for yd acctt I could not finde billes under 35:6 a 7 a 2 uso, butt itt is beleavee
itt will fall, so in case I can finde good bill under that price I shall remitted
you, if not buy the gold & send itt as you desire assureing you that I am
more zealous to prevent yd want, as itt can be exspected from the debts att
present, butt towards spring itt will be better I hope my last shall
given you content as to our articles if not advise mee, thought I
wee minde one the same case & differs in expression onely: the acctt
or generall hath tarried because Rap. coots did not send the acctt o
charges somer, besides have been in disposed some dayes & now god beta
better do faithfully promise you to draw itt out & send itt the latter
